channel.title: Loading screen background
channel.description: Hi i just have been working on my very first rsps and i was wondering how to change the background image? I want it to be just like the old rs2 backorund like this: http://www.pixeloaded.com/newrunescrap/gallery/data/media/19/rs9.JPG but with the flames moving if possible and how do i swap it from the old one to the new one?

item.title: Loading screen background
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“arcuza, post:9, topic:429780”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=532458.msg3891811#msg3891811 date=1326931591]

The flames already move independent of the background image.

The image is actually only 1/2 of the entire background. The client flips the image while loading to make it look like one complete image.

If your client is loading images from a directory, then you’ll probably find the image there.

If it’s loading everything from the cache, then you can change the image with one of the available cache editors.

how do i do this like where do i locate the old rs2 file to add it to the cache i’m very new to this

Well if your client loads the image from the local filesystem, then all you would have to do is replace the file.

If it loads the image from the cache, you’ll have to use one of the available cache editors and replace the image.

is it the image called title?

Possibly. I don’t know your particular client settings, so I can’t say for certain.

ok i got it working and as you said it’s flipped on one half how do i fix that?

Crop the image in half (so the dimensions of the image should be 384x503) and make sure the image is what you want on the left side.
[/quote]
thankyou very much! but one more thing the flames arn’t moving :S[/quote]

Then it was probably commented out in the client.

Let me check my client to see what you would need to change.

Read full topic

@arcuza wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:8, topic:429780”][quote author=arcuza link=topic=532458.msg3891795#msg3891795 date=1326931064]

The flames already move independent of the background image.

The image is actually only 1/2 of the entire background. The client flips the image while loading to make it look like one complete image.

If your client is loading images from a directory, then you’ll probably find the image there.

If it’s loading everything from the cache, then you can change the image with one of the available cache editors.

how do i do this like where do i locate the old rs2 file to add it to the cache i’m very new to this

Well if your client loads the image from the local filesystem, then all you would have to do is replace the file.

If it loads the image from the cache, you’ll have to use one of the available cache editors and replace the image.

is it the image called title?

Possibly. I don’t know your particular client settings, so I can’t say for certain.

ok i got it working and as you said it’s flipped on one half how do i fix that?
[/quote]

Crop the image in half (so the dimensions of the image should be 384x503) and make sure the image is what you want on the left side.[/quote]
thankyou very much! but one more thing the flames arn’t moving :S

Read full topic

item.title: Loading screen background
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“arcuza, post:7, topic:429780”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=532458.msg3891788#msg3891788 date=1326930841]

The flames already move independent of the background image.

The image is actually only 1/2 of the entire background. The client flips the image while loading to make it look like one complete image.

If your client is loading images from a directory, then you’ll probably find the image there.

If it’s loading everything from the cache, then you can change the image with one of the available cache editors.

how do i do this like where do i locate the old rs2 file to add it to the cache i’m very new to this

Well if your client loads the image from the local filesystem, then all you would have to do is replace the file.

If it loads the image from the cache, you’ll have to use one of the available cache editors and replace the image.

is it the image called title?

Possibly. I don’t know your particular client settings, so I can’t say for certain.
[/quote]
ok i got it working and as you said it’s flipped on one half how do i fix that?[/quote]

Crop the image in half (so the dimensions of the image should be 384x503) and make sure the image is what you want on the left side.
